title: PAIRBENCH: A Systematic Framework for Selecting Reliable Judge VLMs
author: Aarash Feizi (ServiceNow Research), Sai Rajeswar (ServiceNow Research), Adriana Romero-Soriano (McGill University), Reihaneh Rabbany (McGill University), Spandana Gella (ServiceNow Research), Valentina Zantedeschi (ServiceNow Research), Joao Monteiro (AutoDesk), ...
relevance_why: The proposed framework PAIRBENCH is relevant as it provides systematic evaluation metrics for vision-language models (VLMs) that could be applicable to analyzing a range of data modalities including audio and speech through their multimodal capabilities.
background: Assessing the reliability of vision-language models as evaluators across various tasks and datasets to determine their capability in scoring similarity between data pairs.
contribution: This paper introduces PAIRBENCH, a low-cost framework to evaluate the reliability of vision-language models, achieving systematic ranking of these models on various similarity metrics.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods for evaluating model performance often relied on expensive human annotations or standard benchmarks, lacking control and customization.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by providing a customizable framework that evaluates multiple metrics (MMScore, ε-RelaxSym, Smoothness, Controllability) to ascertain VLMs' capabilities.

key_innovation: The creation of synthetic datasets with controlled features, alongside metrics that assess the symmetry and reliability of similarity judgments.
real_world_impact: The framework can enhance the selection and application of VLMs in real-world scenarios, improving accuracy in automatic evaluation tasks across various industries.
limitations: No explicit limitations are mentioned, but potential biases in VLMs may still affect their performance despite evaluation.

new_terms.vision-language models (VLMs): **Vision-language models (VLMs)** are AI systems designed to understand and generate content that combines both visual and textual information.
new_terms.\u03b5-RelaxSym: **ε-RelaxSym** is a metric introduced to measure the symmetry of similarity scores produced by models, allowing for a margin of error to assess model performance effectively.

open_sourcing: The four datasets created by PAIRBENCH are available for public use.
